class_notes: This course examines the scientific basis and applications of nutrition assessment through series of lectures and activities. We will explore the five domains of nutrition assessment with particular focus on the anthropometric, biochemical, and dietary markers and methodologies used in the determination of nutrition status in individuals and populations.
course_description: We will explore the scientific basis and potential application for the five domains of nutrition assessment with particular focus on the anthropometric, biochemical, and dietary markers and methodologies used in the determination of nutrition status in individuals and populations.
prerequisites: HLTH 220 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2570, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: M. Woodworth-Hobbs, Status: Open
